intro: Nonea caspica, commonly known as the Caspian nonea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Caspian Sea region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It features finely divided leaves and small white or yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered in many areas.
